title: State of Oregon Selects EnergyCAP Software to Achieve Energy Reduction Goals
text:
State of Oregon Selects EnergyCAP Software to Achieve Energy Reduction Goals September 28, 2015 10:32 ET | Source: EnergyCAP, Inc. 
STATE COLLEGE, Pa., Sept. 28, 2015 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The State of Oregon has selected EnergyCAP software for its new Electronic Utility Data Management and Reporting Service following a competitive bid process. EnergyCAP will enable the State to measure, track, and report building energy, water, and solid waste in order to increase efficiency, save operating costs, and meet sustainability goals. Presented in 2013, the Governor's Ten Year Action Plan focuses on reducing energy use by 20% in state-owned buildings by the year 2023. In order to meet its goal, the plan includes energy auditing, building retrofits, and energy reporting at the building level through EnergyCAP software. The Department of Administrative Services will manage EnergyCAP for the State. "We have found EnergyCAP great to work with and are excited to build our utility management program around the EnergyCAP database and reporting capability," said Mike Wirkkula, Energy Analyst for Department of Administrative Services. In addition to tracking use and cost for every utility meter, EnergyCAP will measure and verify the dollar savings attributable to energy conservation projects. Each month, EnergyCAP's Bill CAPture service will convert the State's 600 utility bills in PDF or scanned image format and import them into the software database. Two years of historical data will also be converted and imported during the initial implementation. "This project is proof that Oregon state government is committed to achieving the efficiency and conservation goals in the Governor's Ten Year Plan â€“ they don't just say it, they act," said Steve Heinz, Founder and CEO of EnergyCAP, Inc. "Oregon joins a number of other state governments in establishing energy reduction goals and using EnergyCAP to track their progress." State of Oregon's website is http://www.oregon.gov and EnergyCAP's website is http://www.EnergyCAP.com . About EnergyCAP, Inc. 
For more than 30 years, the award-winning EnergyCAP software has helped 10,000 energy managers to track more than $25 billion in energy spending. EnergyCAP utility bill and energy management software helps users get value from their utility bills and meter data. Software features include bill entry (manual, spreadsheet import, and EDI), bill tracking, an optional AP/GL interface, customizable bill approval workflow, audits, rate schedules, interval and production data tracking, cost avoidance (M &V), issue tracking, submeter tracking, virtual meter formulas, re-billing, greenhouse gas tracking, 300+ reports, automated ENERGY STAR building data submittal, building benchmarking, and graphical PowerViews.
